<div class=WordSection1>

<h2><span class=SpellE><span style='font-size:13.5pt;font-family:"Tahoma","sans-serif";
mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman";color:red'>CompSci</span></span><span
style='font-size:13.5pt;font-family:"Tahoma","sans-serif";mso-fareast-font-family:
"Times New Roman";color:red'> (CS) 171 — Introduction to Artificial
Intelligence — Winter 2012</span><span style='mso-fareast-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'><o:p></o:p></span></h2>

<div class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'>

<hr size=2 width="100%" align=center>

</div>

<p class=MsoNormal><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span
style='font-family:"Tahoma","sans-serif";color:red'>Current Announcements: <o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span
style='font-family:"Tahoma","sans-serif";color:red'><o:p> </o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoListParagraphCxSpFirst style='text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l1 level1 lfo2'><![if !supportLists]><span
style='font-family:Symbol;mso-fareast-font-family:Symbol;mso-bidi-font-family:
Symbol'><span style='mso-list:Ignore'>·<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'>        
</span></span></span><![endif]><span style='font-family:"Tahoma","sans-serif"'>(23
March) The Final Exam answer key is posted below and is also available <a
href="../cs171-old-tests/2012-wq-cs171-old-tests/2012-wq-cs-171-final-exam-key.pdf">here</a>.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoListParagraphCxSpMiddle style='text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l1 level1 lfo2'><![if !supportLists]><span
style='font-family:Symbol;mso-fareast-font-family:Symbol;mso-bidi-font-family:
Symbol'><span style='mso-list:Ignore'>·<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'>        
</span></span></span><![endif]><span style='font-family:"Tahoma","sans-serif"'>(15
March) The quiz #4 answer key is posted below and is also available <a
href="../cs171-old-tests/2012-wq-cs171-old-tests/2012-wq-cs-171-quiz-4-key.pdf">here</a>.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoListParagraphCxSpMiddle style='text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l1 level1 lfo2'><![if !supportLists]><span
style='font-family:Symbol;mso-fareast-font-family:Symbol;mso-bidi-font-family:
Symbol'><span style='mso-list:Ignore'>·<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'>        
</span></span></span><![endif]><span style='font-family:"Tahoma","sans-serif"'>(13
March) </span><span class=moz-txt-tag><b>*</b></span><b>Please<span
class=moz-txt-tag>*</span></b> fill out your student course evaluations for
CS-171. <br>
Student course evaluations are very important to me for monitoring and
improving the course content, and very important to UCI for evaluating our
success at our educational mission. <br>
****<span class=GramE>  Every</span> student who fills out a course
evaluation for CS-171 will receive a bonus of 1% added to their final grade,
free and clear, off the curve, simply a bonus.  **** <br>
EEE will return to me the names of students who fill out evaluations (but not
the content, which remains anonymous), provided that enough students fill out
evaluations so that anonymity is not compromised.  I will add 1% free
bonus to the final grade of each such named student.<span style='font-family:
"Tahoma","sans-serif"'><o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoListParagraphCxSpMiddle style='text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l1 level1 lfo2'><![if !supportLists]><span
style='font-family:Symbol;mso-fareast-font-family:Symbol;mso-bidi-font-family:
Symbol'><span style='mso-list:Ignore'>·<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'>        
</span></span></span><![endif]><span style='font-family:"Tahoma","sans-serif"'>(6
March) The quiz #3 answer key is posted below and is also available <a
href="../cs171-old-tests/2012-wq-cs171-old-tests/2012-wq-cs-171-quiz-3-key.pdf">here</a>.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoListParagraphCxSpMiddle style='text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l1 level1 lfo2'><![if !supportLists]><span
style='font-family:Symbol;mso-fareast-font-family:Symbol;mso-bidi-font-family:
Symbol'><span style='mso-list:Ignore'>·<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'>        
</span></span></span><![endif]><span style='font-family:"Tahoma","sans-serif"'>(28
Feb) As announced in class, Chapter 9 (Inference in FOL) has been cancelled in
favor of learning FOL itself better (Chapter 8).<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoListParagraphCxSpMiddle style='text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l1 level1 lfo2'><![if !supportLists]><span
style='font-family:Symbol;mso-fareast-font-family:Symbol;mso-bidi-font-family:
Symbol'><span style='mso-list:Ignore'>·<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'>        
</span></span></span><![endif]><span style='font-family:"Tahoma","sans-serif"'>(28
Feb) As announced in class and posted to the class email list, the Mid-term
exam is now a pedagogical device.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoListParagraphCxSpMiddle style='margin-left:1.0in;mso-add-space:
auto;text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l2 level2 lfo4'><![if !supportLists]><span
style='font-family:"Courier New";mso-fareast-font-family:"Courier New"'><span
style='mso-list:Ignore'>o<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'>  
</span></span></span><![endif]><span style='font-family:"Tahoma","sans-serif"'>You
can recover 50% of your missed points by showing that you have debugged and
repaired your knowledge base.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoListParagraphCxSpMiddle style='margin-left:1.0in;mso-add-space:
auto;text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l2 level2 lfo4'><![if !supportLists]><span
style='font-family:"Courier New";mso-fareast-font-family:"Courier New"'><span
style='mso-list:Ignore'>o<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'>  
</span></span></span><![endif]><span style='font-family:"Tahoma","sans-serif"'>For
each item where points were deducted, write 2-4 sentences, and perhaps an
equation or two.<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>Describe:<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoListParagraphCxSpMiddle style='margin-left:1.0in;mso-add-space:
auto;text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l1 level2 lfo2'><![if !supportLists]><span
style='font-family:"Courier New";mso-fareast-font-family:"Courier New"'><span
style='mso-list:Ignore'>o<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'>  
</span></span></span><![endif]><span style='font-family:"Tahoma","sans-serif"'>*
What was the bug in the knowledge base leading to the error?<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoListParagraphCxSpMiddle style='margin-left:1.0in;mso-add-space:
auto;text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l1 level2 lfo2'><![if !supportLists]><span
style='font-family:"Courier New";mso-fareast-font-family:"Courier New"'><span
style='mso-list:Ignore'>o<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'>  
</span></span></span><![endif]><span style='font-family:"Tahoma","sans-serif"'>*
How has the knowledge base been repaired so that the error will not happen
again?<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoListParagraphCxSpMiddle style='margin-left:1.0in;mso-add-space:
auto;text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l1 level2 lfo2'><![if !supportLists]><span
style='font-family:"Courier New";mso-fareast-font-family:"Courier New"'><span
style='mso-list:Ignore'>o<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'>  
</span></span></span><![endif]><span style='font-family:"Tahoma","sans-serif"'>Turn
in, with your exam, in class on Thursday, 1 March.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoListParagraphCxSpMiddle style='margin-left:1.0in;mso-add-space:
auto;text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l1 level2 lfo2'><![if !supportLists]><span
style='font-family:"Courier New";mso-fareast-font-family:"Courier New"'><span
style='mso-list:Ignore'>o<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'>  
</span></span></span><![endif]><span style='font-family:"Tahoma","sans-serif"'>50%
of your missed points will be forgiven for each correct repair.</span></p>

<p class=MsoListParagraphCxSpMiddle style='text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l1 level1 lfo2'><![if !supportLists]><span
style='font-family:Symbol;mso-fareast-font-family:Symbol;mso-bidi-font-family:

<h2><span style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>Place:
<a href="http://www.classrooms.uci.edu/GAC/ICS180.html">ICS-180</a> (In the
basement of <a href="http://www.classrooms.uci.edu/GAC/ICS.html">Building 302</a>

<h2><span style='font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Arial","sans-serif";mso-fareast-font-family:
"Times New Roman";color:red'>Goal:</span><span style='font-size:12.0pt;
mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman"'><o:p></o:p></span></h2>

<h2><span style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman";
color:black'>The goal of this class is to familiarize you with the basic
principles of artificial intelligence. You will l</span><span style='font-size:
12.0pt;mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>earn <span style='color:black'>some
</span>basic AI techniques, the problems for which they are applicable, and
their limitations.<o:p></o:p></span></h2>

<h2><span style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>The
course content is organized roughly around what are often considered to be
three central pillars of AI: Search, Logic, and Learning. Topics covered
include basic search, heuristic search, game search, constraint satisfaction,
knowledge representation, logic and inference, probabilistic modeling, and
machine learning algorithms. <o:p></o:p></span></h2>

<div class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'>

<hr size=2 width="100%" align=center>

</div>

<h2><span style='font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Arial","sans-serif";mso-fareast-font-family:
"Times New Roman";color:red'>Class Setup:</span><span style='font-size:12.0pt;
mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman"'><o:p></o:p></span></h2>

<h2><span style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>The
course will be primarily lecture-based.<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'> 
</span>There will be a Mid-term and a Final Exam.<span
style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>On every second Tuesday, the first 20
minutes will be an in-class pop quiz, followed by lecture.<span
style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>The frequent quizzes are intended to
encourage you to stay current with the course material.<span
style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>All exams and quizzes may cover all
material presented in class, including lectures and assigned textbook
reading.<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>Quizzes will cover mostly
material presented since the last quiz, and also may include questions that
many students missed on the previous quiz.<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'> 
</span>The Final Exam will cover mostly material since the Mid-term Exam, and
also will include some questions intended to encourage you to remember the
earlier material.<o:p></o:p></span></h2>

<h2><span style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>There
will be an AI coding project, in which you will be provided with a
“dumb” GUI shell, for which you will be required to code the
“smarts.”<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>You are
allowed (but not required) to form teams of two students, following the “<a
href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pair_programming">Pair Programming</a>”
paradigm.<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>Please note that you are
encouraged to discuss concepts, methods, algorithms, etc.; but you are
forbidden to copy: (1) source code from any source, or (2) text from any source
unless properly cited and set off as a quote.<span
style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>Except for class materials provided from
this class website, you must invent and write all of your own code by yourself
with your partner.<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>Except for
properly referenced material, you must write all of your project report by
yourself with your partner. Please note that your source code and project
report are subject to analysis by automated plagiarism detection programs, and
that direct copying will be treated as an act of academic dishonesty (please see
the section on “<a href="#_Academic_Honesty:">Academic Honesty</a>”
below).<o:p></o:p></span></h2>

<h2><span style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>Homework
will be assigned, but is not graded. The reason is that prior student course
evaluations alerted me to the existence of student cheating by way of copying
the homework answers.<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>I deplore
this degree of personal degradation in dishonest students, but I cannot control
it, and so I avoid the opportunity.<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'> 
</span>I remain determined to create a fair and honest educational experience
for all students, as best I can.<o:p></o:p></span></h2>

<h2><span style='font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Arial","sans-serif";mso-fareast-font-family:
"Times New Roman";color:black'>

<hr size=2 width="100%" align=left>

</span></h2>

<h2><span style='font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Arial","sans-serif";mso-fareast-font-family:
"Times New Roman";color:red'>Textbook</span><span style='font-size:12.0pt;
mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman"'><o:p></o:p></span></h2>

<h2><span style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman";
color:red'>Required:</span><span style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-fareast-font-family:
"Times New Roman";color:black'><span style='mso-spacerun:yes'> 
</span>Russell & <span class=SpellE><span class=GramE>Norvig</span></span><span
class=GramE> :</span> Artificial Intelligence; A Modern Approach, 3<sup>rd</sup>
edition.<o:p></o:p></span></h2>

<p><span style='mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman";color:black'>The
course is based on, and the UCI bookstore has, the 3<sup>rd</sup> edition. The
assigned textbook reading is required, and is fair game for quizzes and
exams.<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>You place yourself at a
distinct disadvantage if you do not have the textbook.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p><span style='mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman";color:black'>I
strongly recommend the 3<sup>rd</sup> edition.<span
style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>R&N estimates that about 20% of the
material in the 3<sup>rd</sup> edition is new from the 2<sup>nd</sup>
edition.<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>Several of the chapters
and exercises have been rearranged.</span><strong> </strong><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>(</b>A kind and helpful student has
elucidated some of the differences between the 2<sup>nd</sup> & 3<sup>rd</sup>
editions; <a href="../differencesEd3vsEd2.pdf">click here</a>.)<span
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'><o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p><span style='mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman";color:black'>Also,
for your convenience, I have requested that a copy of the textbook be placed on
reserve in the UCI Science Library.</span><strong><span style='font-weight:
normal;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'> There is a two-hour check-out limit.<o:p></o:p></span></strong></p>

<p><strong><span style='font-weight:normal;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'>I do deplore
the high cost of textbooks.<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>You are
likely to find the book cheaper if you search online at EBay.com, Amazon.com,
and related sites.<o:p></o:p></span></strong></p>

<p><strong><span style='font-weight:normal;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'>A student
kindly contributed the following suggestion, for which I cannot vouch, and
which I provide for your use if it is useful to you:<o:p></o:p></span></strong></p>

<p><span style='background:yellow;mso-highlight:yellow'>Hello, <br>
<br>
I just wanted to point out that there does <span class=GramE>exist</span> an

cannot comment on what specific differences there are for this particular book,
though they are usually very small (exercises moved around, <span class=SpellE>etc</span>).
Obviously, it is in paperback. <br>
<br>
<a href="http://www.valorebooks.com/affiliate/buy/siteID=e79mzf/ISBN=0136042597">http://www.valorebooks.com/affiliate/buy/siteID=e79mzf/ISBN=0136042597</a>
<br>

<h2><a name="_Syllabus:"></a><span style='font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Arial","sans-serif";
mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman";color:red'>Syllabus:</span><span
style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman"'><o:p></o:p></span></h2>

<p><b>The following represents a preliminary syllabus. Some changes in the
lecture sequence may occur due to earthquakes, fires, floods, wars, natural
disasters, unnatural disasters, or the discretion of the instructor based on
class progress.<o:p></o:p></b></p>

<p><b>Background Reading and Lecture Slides will be changed or revised as the
class progresses at the discretion of the instructor.<span
style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>Please note:<span
style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>I may tweak or revise the lecture slides
prior to the lecture; please ensure that you have the current version.<o:p></o:p></b></p>

<p><b>Please read the assigned textbook reading <span style='color:red'>in
advance </span>of each lecture, then <span style='color:red'>again after </span>each
lecture.<o:p></o:p></b></p>

<p><span style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif";color:red'><br>
</span><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif";
color:#0033BB'>Week 1:</span><span style='mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'><o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p style='margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif";color:#0033BB'><span
style='mso-tab-count:1'>            </span></span></b><span
class=GramE><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='font-family:
"Arial","sans-serif";color:black'>Tue., 10 Jan., Introduction, Agents.</span></b></span><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif";
color:black'> <o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p style='margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif";color:black'><span
style='mso-tab-count:2'>                        </span>Read
in Advance: Textbook Chapters 1-2.<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p style='margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif";color:black'><span

<p style='margin-top:0in;margin-right:0in;margin-bottom:0in;margin-left:.5in;

style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif";color:black'><span style='mso-tab-count:
1'>            </span>Alan
Turing is the most famous computer scientist of all time.<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p style='margin-top:0in;margin-right:0in;margin-bottom:0in;margin-left:1.0in;
margin-bottom:.0001pt;text-indent:.5in'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span
style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif";color:black'>The Turing Award is the
highest honor in computer science.<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p style='margin-top:0in;margin-right:0in;margin-bottom:0in;margin-left:1.5in;
margin-bottom:.0001pt'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span
style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif";color:black'>The Turing Machine is
still our fundamental theoretical model of computation.<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p style='margin-top:0in;margin-right:0in;margin-bottom:0in;margin-left:1.5in;
margin-bottom:.0001pt'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span
style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif";color:black'>Turing’s work on the
Enigma code in WWII led to programmable computers.<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<h2><a name="_Optional_Projects:"></a><span style='font-size:12.0pt;font-family:
"Arial","sans-serif";color:red'>Project:</span><span style='font-size:12.0pt;
color:red'><o:p></o:p></span></h2>

<p class=MsoNormal><span style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif"'><o:p> </o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-indent:.25in'><span class=GramE><span
style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif"'>[Maze Solver].</span></span><span
style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif"'><span style='mso-spacerun:yes'> 
</span>This project corresponds to Informed Search Problems (Chapter 3 in your
book). Your job is to write an AI agent that can find paths through a maze
better than you can. <a
href="../projects/maze-solver/Maze%20Project%20Grading%20Rubric.docx">Click
here for the grading rubric.</a><o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-indent:.25in'><span style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif"'><o:p> </o:p></span></p>

<h2 style='margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt'><span style='font-size:12.0pt;
font-weight:normal;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'>You are employed by a company
that makes interactive video games. The game's 2D world has a large number of
fixed polygonal obstacles of various shapes and sizes on the screen. You are
assigned to write the controller for one of the moving figures on the screen.
Whenever a gold coin appears on the screen, your figure is to walk to the coin
as rapidly as possible, avoiding all obstacles. Input is the screen locations
of your figure, the gold coin, and the locations and shapes of all obstacles.
Output is to be the path your figure will follow to the coin. [Click here for
solved examples.]</span><o:p></o:p></h2>

<h2 style='margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt'><span style='font-size:12.0pt;
font-weight:normal;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'><u1:p> </u1:p></span></h2>

<h2 style='margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt'><span style='font-size:12.0pt;
font-weight:normal;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'>Interestingly, this is also the
same basic problem as robot arm navigation through a crowded workspace. In the
robot arm navigation problem, the task is to go from one arm position (the
initial position) to some other specified arm position (the goal position)
without colliding with any objects in the workspace. In general, this problem
is representative of a whole class of related planning and navigation problems.<u1:p></u1:p></span></h2>

<h2><span style='font-size:12.0pt;font-weight:normal;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'>Demonstrate,
benchmark, and compare Breadth-First, Depth-First, Uniform Cost, Bidirectional
(using Uniform-Cost), Iterative Deepening, Greedy Best First, and A* search on
this route-finding problem.<u1:p></u1:p><span style='mso-spacerun:yes'> 
</span><span style='background:yellow;mso-highlight:yellow'>All of the
uninformed searches will be due midnight, 2 March; all of the heuristic
searches will be due midnight, 16 March; 5% penalty for each late day or
fraction thereof.</span></span></h2>

<h2><span style='font-size:12.0pt;font-weight:normal;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'>[A
<a href="../projects/maze-solver/JavaPolygon">Java shell</a> is available (and <a
href="../projects/maze-solver/JavaPolygon.zip">zipped</a>); a <a
href="../projects/maze-solver/JavaPolygon/Java%20Polygon%20Description.pdf">Java
description</a> is available; a <a href="../projects/maze-solver/CppPolygon">C++
shell</a> is available (and <a href="../projects/maze-solver/CppPolygon.zip">zipped</a>);
a <a href="../projects/maze-solver/CppPolygon/Cpp%20Polygon%20Description.pdf">C++
description</a> is available; an <a href="../projects/maze-solver/game.exe">example
game</a> is available; <a href="../projects/maze-solver/TestFiles">test files</a>
are available]<o:p></o:p></span></h2>

<h2><span style='font-size:12.0pt;font-weight:normal;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'>EXTRA
CREDIT OPPORTUNITIES:<o:p></o:p></span></h2>

<h2><span style='font-size:12.0pt;font-weight:normal;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'>5%
will be added to your total project score for each of the following
opportunities:<o:p></o:p></span></h2>

<h2 style='margin-left:.5in;text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l0 level1 lfo7'><![if !supportLists]><span
style='font-size:12.0pt;font-family:Symbol;mso-fareast-font-family:Symbol;
mso-bidi-font-family:Symbol;font-weight:normal;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'><span
style='mso-list:Ignore'>·<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'>        
</span></span></span><![endif]><span class=GramE><span style='font-size:12.0pt;
font-weight:normal;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'>5% for implementing a heuristic
that dominates (and sometimes betters) straight-line distance (must execute and
succeed on “<span class=SpellE>bigMaze</span>”).</span></span><span
style='font-size:12.0pt;font-weight:normal;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'><o:p></o:p></span></h2>

style='mso-list:Ignore'>·<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'>        
</span></span></span><![endif]><span class=GramE><span style='font-size:12.0pt;

the “example game” longer to solve with A* than “<span
class=SpellE>bigMaze</span>” takes --- using no more total vertices than

<h2 style='margin-left:.5in;text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l0 level1 lfo7'><![if !supportLists]><span

mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'>5% (to one team only) for devising a maze that takes

has.<o:p></o:p></span></h2>

<h3><a name="_Academic_Honesty:"></a><span style='color:red'>Academic Honesty: </span><span
class=MsoHyperlink><span style='font-family:"Times New Roman","serif";
mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman";color:windowtext;font-weight:normal;
text-decoration:none;text-underline:none'><o:p></o:p></span></span></h3>

<p class=MsoNormal>Academic dishonesty is unacceptable and will not be
tolerated at the University of California, Irvine. It is the responsibility of
each student to be familiar with UCI's current academic honesty policies.
Please take the time to read the current <a
href="http://www.senate.uci.edu/senateweb/default2.asp?active_page_id=754">UCI
Senate Academic Honesty Policies</a> and the <a
href="http://www.ics.uci.edu/ugrad/policies/index.php#cheating">ICS School
policy on cheating</a>.<span class=MsoHyperlink><span style='color:windowtext;
text-decoration:none;text-underline:none'><o:p></o:p></span></span></p>

<p>The policies in these documents will be adhered to scrupulously. Any student
who engages in cheating, forgery, dishonest conduct, plagiarism, or collusion
in dishonest activities, will receive an academic evaluation of ``F'' for the
entire course, with a letter of explanation to the student's permanent file.
The <a href="http://www.ics.uci.edu/grad/sao/index.php">ICS Student Affairs
Office</a> will be involved at every step of the process. Dr. Lathrop seeks to
create a level playing field for all students. </p>
